title: Compton - 90 deg - rank p of photon and electron

content.question: A photon scatters at a <math alttext="90" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>90</mn></math>-degree angle off of an initially stationary electron, as shown in the figure. The photon’s initial velocity is in the positive <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-direction and its final velocity is in the negative <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-direction. The electron has a final velocity with positive <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> and <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math> components. Which of the following correctly ranks the magnitude <math alttext="p sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>p</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math> of the photon’s initial momentum, the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-component <math alttext="p sub e comma x, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>p</mi><mtext>e,x</mtext></msub></math> of the electron’s final momentum, and the <math alttext="y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi></math>-component <math alttext="p sub e comma y, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>p</mi><mtext>e,y</mtext></msub></math> of the electron’s final momentum?
